meanings.definition: Surgical removal of part or all of the liver.
meanings.sent1: The hepatectomy was performed to remove a tumor from the liver.
meanings.sent2: After the hepatectomy, the patient's liver function improved.
meanings.sent3: During the hepatectomy, the liver said, 'I'm feeling a bit lopsided now!'
meanings.sent4: The hepatectomy was like pruning a tree, removing the diseased branches.
meanings.sent5: The surgeon skillfully completed the hepatectomy, leaving the liver healthier.

meanings.definition: The procedure of removing a portion of the liver.
meanings.sent1: A hepatectomy may be necessary to address liver damage.
meanings.sent2: The hepatectomy involved carefully excising the affected liver tissue.
meanings.sent3: The liver requested a mini-hepatectomy, just a trim, please!
meanings.sent4: The hepatectomy was a bold step towards the patient's recovery.
meanings.sent5: Witnessing the hepatectomy made me appreciate the complexity of the liver.
